title: INTERSPEECH_2014_40_abs

sentences.text: This paper deals with the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech from a text input for text-to-speech synthesis .
We have previously introduced a statistical model describing the generating process of speech F0 contours , based on the discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model .

One remarkable feature of this model is that it has allowed us to derive an efficient algorithm based on powerful statistical methods for estimating the Fujisaki-model parameters from raw F0 contours .
To associate a sequence of the Fujisaki-model parameters with a text input based on statistical learning , this paper proposes extending this model to a context-dependent one .
We further propose a parameter training algorithm for the present model based on a decision tree-based context clustering .

Entity-this_paper.label: This paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents a research study focused on generating the fundamental frequency (F0) contour of speech from text input for text-to-speech synthesis, utilizing an extended statistical model based on the Fujisaki model.

Entity-the_generating_process_of_speech_.label: the generating process of speech F0 contours
aliases: the generating process of speech F0 contours
Entity-the_generating_process_of_speech_.description: The generating process of speech F0 contours refers to the statistical modeling and algorithmic approach used to create the fundamental frequency contours of speech from text input, specifically utilizing the discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model for text-to-speech synthesis.

mentions.local_name: the generating process of speech F0 contours

Entity-the_problem_of_generating_the_fun.label: the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech
aliases: the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech
Entity-the_problem_of_generating_the_fun.description: The problem of generating the fundamental frequency (F0) contour of speech refers to the challenge of creating a smooth and natural pitch variation in synthesized speech from textual input, which is essential for effective text-to-speech synthesis.

mentions.local_name: the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech

Entity-this_model.label: this model
Entity-this_model.description: This model refers to a statistical model for generating the fundamental frequency (F0) contour of speech, based on the discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model, which facilitates the estimation of Fujisaki-model parameters from raw F0 contours.

aliases: the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech from a text input for text-to-speech synthesis
the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech from a text input
Entity-the_problem_of_generating_the_fun.description: The challenge of creating a speech pitch contour from written text for the purpose of synthesizing natural-sounding speech.

mentions.local_name: the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech from a text input for text-to-speech synthesis
the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech from a text input

Entity-the_present_model.label: the present model
Entity-the_present_model.description: The present model refers to an extended version of the Fujisaki model for generating speech fundamental frequency contours, which incorporates context-dependent parameters and utilizes a decision tree-based context clustering algorithm for parameter training.

Entity-fujisaki_model.label: Fujisaki model
Entity-fujisaki_model.description: The Fujisaki model is a statistical model used in speech synthesis that describes the generation of fundamental frequency (F0) contours in spoken language.

Entity-the_discrete-time_version_of_the_.label: the discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model
aliases: the discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model
Entity-the_discrete-time_version_of_the_.description: The discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model is a statistical model used for generating the fundamental frequency (F0) contours of speech in text-to-speech synthesis, allowing for efficient parameter estimation from raw F0 data.

mentions.local_name: the discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model

Entity-model.label: model
Entity-model.description: The 'model' refers to a statistical model for generating the fundamental frequency (F0) contour of speech, based on the discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model, which facilitates the estimation of its parameters from raw F0 contours.

Entity-parameter_training_algorithm.label: parameter training algorithm
Entity-parameter_training_algorithm.description: The parameter training algorithm is a method proposed in the paper for estimating the parameters of a context-dependent Fujisaki model used in text-to-speech synthesis, utilizing decision tree-based context clustering.

Entity-raw_f0_contour.label: raw F0 contours
Entity-raw_f0_contour.description: Raw F0 contours refer to the unprocessed fundamental frequency data of speech, which serves as the basis for estimating parameters in statistical models for text-to-speech synthesis.

Entity-the_fujisaki-model_parameter.label: the Fujisaki-model parameters
Entity-the_fujisaki-model_parameter.description: The Fujisaki-model parameters are a set of numerical values that define the characteristics of the Fujisaki model, which is used to describe the intonation patterns in speech by modeling the fundamental frequency (F0) contours.

Entity-parameter.label: parameters
Entity-parameter.description: The term 'parameters' refers to the statistical values associated with the Fujisaki model that are estimated from raw fundamental frequency contours in the context of text-to-speech synthesis.

Entity-f0.label: F0
Entity-f0.description: F0 refers to the fundamental frequency contour of speech, which is a key acoustic feature used in text-to-speech synthesis.

Entity-fujisaki-model_parameter.label: Fujisaki-model parameters
Entity-fujisaki-model_parameter.description: Fujisaki-model parameters are a set of statistical values used in the Fujisaki model to represent the fundamental frequency contours in speech synthesis and analysis.

Entity-a_context-dependent_one.label: a context-dependent one
Entity-a_context-dependent_one.description: The mention 'a context-dependent one' refers to an extension of the Fujisaki model for generating speech fundamental frequency contours that incorporates contextual information to improve the association of model parameters with text inputs in text-to-speech synthesis.

Entity-an_efficient_algorithm.label: an efficient algorithm
Entity-an_efficient_algorithm.description: An efficient algorithm refers to a computational method developed in this paper that utilizes advanced statistical techniques to accurately estimate the parameters of the Fujisaki model from raw fundamental frequency contours in text-to-speech synthesis.

Entity-decision_tree-based_context_clust.label: decision tree-based context clustering
Entity-decision_tree-based_context_clust.description: Decision tree-based context clustering is a machine learning technique used to group context-dependent parameters in speech synthesis models, facilitating efficient parameter training for generating fundamental frequency contours from text input.

Entity-speech_f0_contour.label: speech F0 contours
Entity-speech_f0_contour.description: Speech F0 contours refer to the variations in the fundamental frequency of speech over time, which are important acoustic features that contribute to the prosody and intonation of spoken language.

Entity-powerful_statistical_method.label: powerful statistical methods
Entity-powerful_statistical_method.description: Powerful statistical methods refer to advanced analytical techniques used to estimate parameters of the Fujisaki model from raw fundamental frequency contours in speech synthesis.

Entity-speech.label: speech
Entity-speech.description: In this paper, 'speech' refers to the vocalized form of communication that is being analyzed for its fundamental frequency (F0) contour in the context of text-to-speech synthesis.

Entity-text-to-speech_synthesis.label: text-to-speech synthesis
Entity-text-to-speech_synthesis.description: Text-to-speech synthesis is a technology that converts written text into spoken words using computational methods to generate human-like speech.

Entity-fundamental_frequency.label: fundamental frequency
Entity-fundamental_frequency.description: Fundamental frequency refers to the lowest frequency of a periodic waveform, representing the primary pitch of a sound, and is a key acoustic feature in speech and signal processing.

Entity-statistical_learning.label: statistical learning
Entity-statistical_learning.description: Statistical learning is a framework in machine learning that focuses on understanding and modeling the relationships between data through statistical methods and algorithms.

Entity-statistical_model.label: statistical model
Entity-statistical_model.description: A statistical model is a mathematical representation that uses statistical methods to describe, analyze, and predict patterns or behaviors in data based on underlying probabilistic processes.

Entity-text_input.label: text input
Entity-text_input.description: text input refers to a form of data that is provided in written or typed format for processing or analysis.

Entity-statistical_method.label: statistical methods
Entity-statistical_method.description: Statistical methods are systematic techniques used for collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data to draw conclusions or make informed decisions.

Entity-algorithm.label: algorithm
Entity-algorithm.description: An algorithm is a systematic procedure or set of rules designed to perform a task or solve a problem, often utilizing statistical or computational methods.

Entity-paper.label: paper
Entity-paper.description: A paper is a written work that presents research findings, theories, or analyses, typically in an academic or scholarly context.

summary: This paper deals with the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech from a text input for text-to-speech synthesis . We have previously introduced a statistical model describing the generating process of speech F0 contours , based on the discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model . One remarkable feature of this model is that it has allowed us to derive an efficient algorithm based on powerful statistical methods for estimating the Fujisaki-model parameters from raw F0 contours . To associate a sequence of the Fujisaki-model parameters with a text input based on statistical learning , this paper proposes extending this model to a context-dependent one . We further propose a parameter training algorithm for the present model based on a decision tree-based context clustering .

Predicate-deals_with.label: deals with
Predicate-deals_with.description: The predicate 'deals with' indicates a relationship in which the subject is engaged in addressing, discussing, or analyzing a specific topic or issue represented by the object. It implies that the subject provides information, insights, or solutions related to the object, thereby establishing a connection between the two entities.

Predicate-involves.label: involves
Predicate-involves.description: The predicate 'involves' indicates a relationship where the subject is connected to the object through a process, activity, or concept that requires or includes the object as a necessary component or factor. It suggests that the subject cannot be fully understood or executed without considering the object, highlighting the object's role as integral to the subject's context or function.

Predicate-relates_to.label: relates to
Predicate-relates_to.description: The predicate 'relates to' establishes a connection or association between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject has a relevant or significant link to the object. This connection can imply various forms of relationships, such as causation, relevance, or contextual association, suggesting that understanding or addressing the subject may involve considerations related to the object.

Predicate-describing.label: describing
Predicate-describing.description: The predicate 'describing' serves to establish a relationship where the subject provides an explanation, representation, or account of the characteristics, features, or mechanisms of the object. In this context, the subject is actively conveying information about the object, which can be a process, concept, or phenomenon, thereby enhancing understanding or knowledge regarding the object.

Predicate-derived_from.label: derived from
Predicate-derived_from.description: The predicate 'derived from' indicates a relationship where the subject is a result or outcome that originates from the object. It suggests that the subject has been formed, developed, or evolved based on the characteristics, properties, or information provided by the object. This relationship often implies a process of transformation or extraction, where the essence or features of the object are utilized to create or inform the subject.

Predicate-allowed_us_to_derive.label: allowed us to derive
Predicate-allowed_us_to_derive.description: The predicate 'allowed us to derive' indicates that the subject provides the means, opportunity, or conditions necessary for the subject's agents (often implied as 'us') to obtain or formulate the object. It suggests a facilitative relationship where the subject enables the process of understanding, creating, or extracting the object, which in this case is typically a concept, method, or result.

Predicate-based_on.label: based on
Predicate-based_on.description: The predicate 'based on' indicates that the subject is derived from, influenced by, or constructed upon the principles, ideas, or elements represented by the object. It establishes a foundational relationship where the object serves as a source or reference point that informs or supports the subject.

Predicate-estimated_from.label: estimated from
Predicate-estimated_from.description: The predicate 'estimated from' indicates a relationship where the subject is derived or calculated based on the information or data provided by the object. It implies that the object serves as a source or basis for making an estimation or inference about the subject.

Predicate-allows_to_derive.label: allows to derive
Predicate-allows_to_derive.description: The predicate 'allows to derive' indicates that the subject provides the means, framework, or conditions necessary to obtain or formulate the object. It suggests a facilitative relationship where the subject enables the extraction or creation of the object through a process of reasoning, calculation, or analysis.

Predicate-are_estimated_from.label: are estimated from
Predicate-are_estimated_from.description: The predicate 'are estimated from' indicates a relationship where the subject is derived or calculated based on the information or data provided by the object. It implies a process of analysis or inference where the subject's values or characteristics are determined using the object as a source of input or reference.

Predicate-proposes_extending.label: proposes extending
Predicate-proposes_extending.description: The predicate 'proposes extending' indicates that the subject is putting forward a suggestion or recommendation to broaden or enhance a particular concept, idea, or framework represented by the object. It implies an intention to develop or elaborate on the object in a way that may involve additional elements, considerations, or applications.

Predicate-associated_with.label: associated with
Predicate-associated_with.description: The predicate 'associated with' indicates a relationship or connection between the subject and the object, suggesting that they share a relevant link or correlation. This connection can imply that the subject has a role, relevance, or influence on the object, or that they are part of a broader context where they interact or coexist. The nature of this association can vary, encompassing various types of relationships such as causal, functional, or contextual.

Predicate-proposes.label: proposes
Predicate-proposes.description: The predicate 'proposes' indicates that the subject puts forward a suggestion, idea, or plan regarding the object. It implies an act of recommending or advocating for the object as a potential solution, method, or approach in a given context.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or variation that falls under a more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider scope or set of characteristics that includes the subject, thereby situating the subject within a larger conceptual framework.
